definition: to be confused/to be baffled
one/1/single/a (article)/as soon as/entire/whole/all/throughout/"one" radical in Chinese characters (Kangxi radical 1)/also pr. [yao1] for greater clarity when spelling out numbers digit by digit
head/hair style/the top/end/beginning or end/a stub/remnant/chief/boss/side/aspect/first/leading/classifier for pigs or livestock/CL:個|个[ge4]
suffix for nouns
fog/mist/CL:場|场[chang2],陣|阵[zhen4]
surname Shui
water/river/liquid/beverage/additional charges or income/(of clothes) classifier for number of washes

sentences.english: The annoying thing about the scheme is that it's confusing.
sentences.chinese: 這項計劃可氣的地方是它讓人一頭霧水。

definition: to have nothing to say (idiom)
to remain unmoved
puzzled/bewildered
not in good condition/wrong/fishy
at a loss to know what to do (idiom); bewildered
to make a fuss about nothing (idiom)
to be a real headache/to find sth a real headache/to beat one's brains
to guess/to conjecture/to surmise
hard to say/unpleasant to say/can't be sure
to spend effort/to take trouble/May I trouble you to...? (as part of polite request)/Please would you mind...?
noisy/raucous/to shout and scream
hard to understand/incomprehensible
hard to explain in a few words (idiom); complicated and not easy to express succinctly
to have one's spirits dampened/to feel disappointed
dumbstruck and unable to reply (idiom); left speechless/at a loss for words
to show respect from a distance (idiom)/to remain at a respectful distance
